alert.note: Alert for Haskell; Throckmorton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued February 26 at 8:35PM CST until February 26 at 9:15PM CST by NWS San Angelo
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Angelo has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Haskell County in west central Texas... Throckmorton County in west central Texas... * Until 915 PM CST. * At 834 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Millers Creek Reservoir to near The Intersection Of Us-380 And Highway 222 to 8 miles southeast of Lake Stamford Marina, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Throckmorton around 850 PM CST. Elbert around 900 PM CST. Woodson around 905 PM CST. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include The Intersection Of Us-183 And Us-283, Us-183 Near The Throckmorton- Baylor County Line, The Intersection Of Us- 283 And Ranch Road 209, Lusk and The Intersection Of Us- 380 And Highway 222. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
